column1: 2. More Effective - Kills canine parvo, C.perfringes and TB.
The active agent in Bru-Clean TbC is sodium dichloroisocyanurate (NaDCC), pronounced Di - chloro - iso - cy - an - ur - ate.&#13

While it does provide chlorine for disinfection purposes, it is not a hypochlorite, as is bleach. The chemistry and mode of action of NaDCC is significantly different, providing a product that is more effective and more stable than hypochlorites, particularly in the presence of organic contaminants. Also, unlike bleach, these NaDCC tablets contain a detergent, which provides the use-solution with cleaning properties and a lower surface tension, allowing it to penetrate into cracks and crevices to kill microbes.

NaDCC is an organic chlorine donor that forms a use-solution with a pH of 6 - 7, when mixed with water. Bleach and other hypochlorites, are inorganic chlorine donors, that form alkaline use-solutions, with a pH above 7. There is a huge difference in the anti-microbial efficacy and the stability of the use-solution of these two different types of compounds, even with the pH change as small as that which we see involved in this case, from 6.5 (NaDCC) to 7.5(bleach).

When NaDCC is mixed with water, it yields hypochlorus acid (HOCL) and monosodiumcyanurate (NaOCl) in an acid use- solution. These two ingredients remain in a constant 50 - 50 ratio in the use-solution, so that as part of the free chlorine is used up (due to reaction with bacteria, organic material, etc), part of the combined chlorine in the NaOCl is freed to restore the 50 - 50 ratio and continue the disinfecting process. THIS IS AN IMPORTANT CHARACTERISTIC of Bru-Clean TbC to note , because unlike bleach and all other hypochlorites , this product possesses a reserve killing power that continues to be made available even after contact with organic soils. Bleach would immediately be de-activated on contact with organic soils.

Studies show that undissociated hypochlorus acid (HOCl) has four times the anti-microbial killing power of that associated with hypochlorites. It is believed that this is due to the fact that HOCl is very similar to the structure of HOH (water), of similar molecular size, and is electrically neutral - thus allowing it to penetrate cell walls as easily as water. It is AN IMPORTANT CHARACTERISTIC of Bru-Clean TbC, that when it is diluted, it results in a slightly acidic use - solution in which over 90% of the HOCL is undissociated. This makes it many times more reactive against microbes than is bleach. With bleach, only 10% of the HOCl remains undissociated, as it quickly dissociates into H+ and the hypochlorite ion, OCL-. The hypochlorite ion is electrically charged, and is otherwise, dissimilar to water.

Bleach, which is very reactive, unstable, and very sensitive to light and higher temperatures, begins to degrade almost from the moment it is made. Within a month of being manufactured, it can easily lose a third or more of its activity - losing most of its activity as quickly as two months. Once bleach is mixed with water, it can lose activity so fast that it should be discarded within 1 - 2 hours. Unless activity levels are tested when the hypochlorites are diluted, there is no legal assurance that there is sufficient anti microbial activity for the disinfection task being addressed. Bru-Clean TbC does not show this type of sensitivity in its tablet form and can be used throughout the day, after being diluted with water.
Testing on metal substrates demonstrates that Bru-Clean TbC is about 50% less corrosive then bleach.

The rate at which the tablets dissolve in water is temperature sensitive. In warm water the tablets will typically dissolve in about 2 1/2 minutes, while in cold water it can easily take 5 - 6 minutes.

Hard Water Areas / Rust Stains

Food Processing Plants

1.) Pour up to 16oz. of drain opener directly into clogged drain (if drain has water back-up, pour in the area nearest to the drain).

3.) Pour additional product if drain has not opened in 15 minutes.

4.) Once opened, thoroughly flush drain with running hot water (in larger or smaller drains, use more or less product as required).

*WARNING: Drain Solve can cause severe burns if mishandled or misused. Avoid contact with skin, eyes, and clothing. Harmful or fatal in taken internally. (6 quarts per case)
· Mix 1-2 ounces per gallon of water

Regular Price: $30.72

Upon completion of a complete floor stripping, or even a rinse/cleaning of your hard floor surface, mix 1 to 2 ounces of ""Film Off"" per gallon of hot water. Make sure to use a new, or thoroughly cleaned mop bucket. Simply rinse your floor with a mop on application, or by using an automatic scrubber and following our auto scrubbing procedures. Allow the floor to dry completely, then apply your floor finish as you normally would. This help extends the life of the finish, improves appearance and extends the time between strippings.

The white alkaline film left on floors after stripping, or after using ice melting compounds can prevent floor seals and finishes from adhering properly. Ice melting compounds can also dull and damage floor finish. Film Off can restore colors and neutralize the floor surface to ensure maximum performance from your floor finish. To neutralize ice melt residue, dilute 2 ounces per gallon of water and mop floor with a clean mop, change water frequently.

Film off can also be used as a carpet rinse with an extractor, like our hot water carpet extractor, to remove that graying effect that can occur after carpet cleaning. The carpet can be left in alkaline condition when using a powerful cleaning agent and will need to be neutralized, much like a floor, to achieve a truly natural state. You can read more about these procedures in our carpet cleaning extraction instructions guide.

If you looking for a product that strictly removes ice melt, please take a look at our Concept ""915"" ice melt residue remover, which can be found along with this product in our floor cleaning soaps &

After you've cleaned your floor, we recommend going back over these grouted areas with one of our wet tank vacuums once you are finished cleaning to thoroughly remove all the standing water. You do not water standing water to seep into grout lines, as mold may form and continue to damage your tiled floor. Besides using a wet/dry vacuum, it might also be a good idea to use one of our floor blower dryers to continuously blow air over the area for a day or two to guarantee the entire floor is free from moisture.

Liquid Propane Power Washer,CAM-1000STLEF,"Cam Spray 1000 PSI Liquid Propane Fueled Power Washer
(Single phase liquid propane burner)

This liquid propane fueled power washer is the mobile detailers best friend. It offers extreme power (variable pressure up to 1000 PSI), heat, and the most cost efficient price out of our full line of LP/Natural Gas fired pressure washers. With a 50' hose, this power washer can stay mounted to a cart or trailer as you move around and spray down whatever needs to be cleaned. Since it is heated by propane, the unit must be operated in a well ventilated area, preferable outdoors. The exhaust fumes from this unit can prove to be fatal if ingested directly, or inhaled for extended periods of time. Cam Spray's forced air burner technology with electronic ignition makes it extremely easy to fire up, and keeps it burning cleanly and efficiently for the entire job.

The power washer itself is powered by electricity, and needs a 25 amp circuit. It comes with a 35' power cord with a GFCI plug. Perfect for use with generators, as an on the go, mobile detail station. We also have this exact model available as a natural gas fired pressure washer. For something even more portable than these 2 units, please take a look at our full line of gas powered, diesel fired power washers.

Natural Gas Fired Pressure Washer,CAM-1000STNEF,"Cam Spray 1000 PSI Natural Gas Fired Pressure Washer
(Single phase natural gas burner)

This natural gas model, and the exact same propane powered model, are best designed for permanent installation in a wash area. Both need to be mounted in well ventilated areas due to the exhaust fumes created by the burner. Both models are relatively clean burning, which will eliminate burner maintenance. When paired with the forced air burner technology and electronic ignition, these Cam Spray pressure washers blow the competition out of the water.

With this natural gas fired pressure washer, you get a 35' power cord that is equipped with a GFCI plug, eliminating the risk of shock or electrocution. Powered by triplex ceramic plunger pumps, stainless steel valves, and a thermal relief valve, Cam Spray has allowed you to expect unsurpassed performance from this machine. It will easily outlast all competitive models in hours of use before the pump will need to be rebuilt.

The adjustable thermostat, pressure pop-off, chemical injection, and multiple spray tips are all things that come standard with all our electric powered LP/Natural Gas fired pressure washers.

Features:
· Totally enclosed motor and powder coated frame ensure a long life, even in the harshest of environments.
· Natural gas fired pressure washer can be used indoors or outdoors, but must be properly ventilated if used indoors.
· Adjustable pressure and temperature allow you, the operator, to adjust the output to what you need for each specific job.
· Quick change tips in 0°, 15°, 25° and 40° are included for differing spray patterns.

This explosion proof pressure washer is hydraulically powered and can be used in any environment where electric motors or gas engines cannot be used. It is part of our larger hydraulic powered pressure washers section. All of these pressure washers in that section are small and compact and develop water flow and pressure from an existing hydraulic power source. The required oil pressure is at least 2000 PSI, which will create 4500 PSI of water pressure. For maximum results, you will need 15 GPM at 2200 PSI of hydraulic input to create 5000 PSI.

We do have a few other explosion proof machines available, if you need more than just this pressure washer. We also have a full section of explosion proof rotary floor machines, and an explosion proof fine dust vacuum.

*Caring for Your Carpet Extractor
Your carpet extractor should be winterized between uses if it is to be exposed to freezing temperatures. To winterize your machine, pour 1/2 gallon of windshield wiper fluid into the empty solution tank. Aim the spray gun into the solution tank. Run the pump and spray the gun into the solution tank until the fluid flows from the gun into the tank. Then run 1 gallon of water through the extractor before the next use."

Tackles everything from boats to concrete floors, from aircraft to air filters by hand or by using equipment such as steam cleaners, floor scrubbing machines, foam units, or spray attachments. Can even be used to clean pet cages at animal hospitals, and pet care facilities, when used with our chemical foaming dispensing machine. Take a look at our complete line of floor cleaning de-greasing solutions for other options.

Floors:

815 MX is Brulin's most popular cleaner for general floor maintenance and industrial degreasing. When used as directed, a 1:15 solution easily strips wax from composition tile and terrazzo without injury to asphalt tile or any other flooring. Another 815 MX advantage - it's one of the easiest cleaners to rinse.

Walls:

A dilute solution of 815 MX easily strips soil, even ""smoker's film"" from all washable surfaces.

Institutional Kitchens:

The 815 MX solution cuts grease and soil from vents, grease chutes and filter elements. Scrubbing or agitation is not required for washable filters - just immerse in 1:10 solution of 815 MX, allow 15-20 minutes penetrate and soak time, and rinse under moderate pressure.

Furnace Rooms:

Cleans electrostatic elements and washable filters. Use 1:10 solution to strip cigarette smoke and tars from hotel and restaurant ventilating system filters. Soak as above and rinse. 815 MX also degreases furnace parts and boiler room equipment.

General Factory Use:

To degrease engines, machinery and equipment, and conveyors, a 1:10 solution of 815 MX can be sprayed, brushed or wiped on, used in a dip tank, and rinsed with water. The 815 MX Gel Method, is the most preferred method for industrial cleaning of production and materials handling equipment. Emulsified soils may be flushed down drains, eliminating disposal problems."

A unique formulation that kills foam quickly and effectively in vacuum systems of carpet and upholstery cleaning equipment. This defoaming agent breaks down foam and eliminates the possibility of it being sucked through the vacuum motor of your machine. If that foam were to be sucked through the motor, your warranty would be null and void on the unit. Using a defoamer is essential part of the recovery process. If you were looking for smaller containers of defoamer, please check out our complete line of liquid defoaming solutions.

This defoamer performs best if it is sucked up through the recovery hose on an extractor, or through the squeegee recovery system on an auto scrubber. This helps to break down foam at all points in the recovery process. We recommend using this product with all of the portable carpet spotters, carpet scrubbers, box extractors, and walk behind floor scrubbers that we sell to protect their vacuum motors.

The 29 quart stainless cleanroom mopping bucket can be purchased separately if an extra one is needed, but this system comes with 2. A 18"" wringer is also included, to complete this package.

Marbalex Stone and Marble Floor Cleaner,STO-30100,"Stone Care International Marbalex Stone Floor Cleaner
(12 quarts per case)
Regular Price: $147.24
Sale

Price: $113.33

Take a look at our complete line of stone care products.

Marbalex is a daily use pH7 balanced stone cleaner designed to safely clean all porous stone surfaces without harming the stone's natural crystalline structure. Marbalex is a natural formulation with precise activity levels designed to maintain all domestic and imported marble, granite, terrazzo, agglomerate, slate, terra cotta, limestone, and all other natural stone surfaces without leaving a residue.

Marbalex will gently preserve the elegance of natural stone without hurting the environment. It is a user friendly product that will not react to the natural minerals of stone, yet it will thoroughly clean the porous surface of stone. Marbalex's rinse free formula will not dull, etch, corrode, or scratch any stone texture. It is ideal for both interior and exterior use. It can be used in an automatic scrubber, pressure washer, or used with a sponge or mop. It is perfect for installation clean up. Marbalex is UL Classified for Slip Resistance.

Applications:

Marble, Granite, Slate, Terra Cotta, Limestone, Terrazzo, Agglomerates, Sanded Grout

Textures/Surfaces:

Polished, Honed, Flamed/Thermal, Tumbled, Cross Cut, Bush Hammered, Sawn

Approximate Coverage per Quart:
Polished Marble &
· Provides residue free cleaning that will dissolve ice melt and salt crystals in winter.
· Will remove organic, biological, and inorganic soils that harm stone surfaces.
· Is an excellent for thorough rinsing of stripper residue (alkali).
· Reduces acid residue from recrystallization and powder polishing.

· MARBALEX is so gentle that it will not damage the stone surface even if it is used over mixed.

Quality Assurance:
· Always test a small area before using to assure compatibility.

· Test Area: Apply the penetrating sealer to a small area at the project site in accordance to the manufacturer's directions on the bottle label. Be sure to record all the test results including coverage and stain prevention.
· Always test on a small area before using.
· Natural stone should be protected with STONEGUARD PENETRATING SEALER.

· Follow the recommended SCI maintenance procedures for MARBALEX.

Preparing the Surface:
· Be sure that the surface is free from loose debris and sediment.

· Dust mop all stone floors daily to keep abrasive debris off of the surface.

Wet Mopping:
· Use two ounces of MARBALEX to one gallon of warm or cold water. &#13
· Use clean Rayon Mops or clean Sponge Mops.&#13

· Change the mop solution every 1,000 to 2,000 square feet.

Automatic Scrubbing:
· Use two ounces of MARBALEX to one gallon of warm or cold water.

· Rough surface stone should be scrubbed with a STONEGLIDE BETA Brush

High Pressure Washing:

· Use four ounces of MARBALEX to one gallon of warm or cold water.

Intensive Cleaning:

· Use six to eight ounces of MARBALEX to one gallon of warm water and follow proper application procedures.

Sponge Cleaning (Removing thin set residue):
· Dilute two to four ounces of MARBALEX to one gallon of warm water.
· Apply solution to the surface and let it set for two minutes.

Marbalex is an ideal concentrated stone floor cleaner for Marble Tile, Granite Tile, Limestone, Slate, Terra Cotta, Grout, Travertine, Soap Stone, Flag Stone and all other types of natural stone floor tiles. Marbalex is a streak free formula that is ideal for residential and commercial use and it is UL Classified for Slip Resistance. There is no rinsing required."

Light soil (2 ounces to 1 gallon of warm water)
<dd>Medium soil (6 ounces to 1 gallon of warm water) Heavy soil (10 ounces to 1 gallon of warm water)</dd>
2. Apply solution with a clean rayon mop or sponge mop.
3. Let solution set for one minute. (On polished marble or limestone let it set for a maximum of one minute.)
4. Pick up solution with a mop or wet/dry vacuum.

5. Lightly rinse with MARBALEX using a clean rayon mop or sponge mop.

Spray Cleaning:
· Dilute STONE QUEST at 1 ounce per quart of warm water.
· Spray onto the stone surface and let it set for two minutes. (On polished marble or limestone let it set for a maximum of one minute.)
· Wipe off with a clean soft cloth.

· Rinse with MARBALEX.

Automatic Scrubbing (Ceramic, Terra Cotta, Terrazzo, Cement):
· Dilute 2 ounces per gallon of warm water.
· Use a STONEGLIDE ALPHA Brush on smooth surfaces and a STONEGLIDE BETA Brush on rough surfaces.</font>&#13
· Follow all of the above procedures and increase the dilution ratio as needed.
· Never use STONE QUEST undiluted on polished surfaces."
